description: A development plan for a mobile-first web-based cinematography coach that provides real-time guidance and effects for various camera shots.

phases.title: Project Scaffolding and Mobile-First UI
phases.description: Set up the core files and build a responsive, mobile-first UI for browsing shots.

steps.description: Create the core files: index.html, style.css, and script.js.
Add CDN links for Bootstrap and TensorFlow.js. Add viewport meta tag for mobile responsiveness.
outputs: index.html with required tags and links

steps.description: Use the Fetch API in script.js to load shots.json and config.json.
Dynamically generate a mobile-first, single-column list of shots using Bootstrap's grid system.
outputs: Function to render a responsive shot list

phases.title: Shot Detail and Touch Interaction
phases.description: Build the detail view with large, touch-friendly controls.

steps.description: Create a function to render the detail view, ensuring all elements are legible and easily tappable on a mobile screen.
outputs: Function to render a mobile-friendly shot detail view

steps.description: Implement the step-by-step guidance display with clear, readable text for mobile.
Ensure all interactive elements (buttons, links) are large enough for easy touch interaction.

phases.title: Mobile Camera and Solver Engine
phases.description: Implement camera functionality with mobile-specific features and performance considerations.

steps.description: Access the mobile device's camera. Implement a button to switch between front and back cameras.
outputs: Camera view with a camera-switcher button

steps.description: Implement video recording. Ensure performance is acceptable on mobile devices.
Select and load lightweight TensorFlow.js models (e.g., MoveNet-Lightning) suitable for mobile performance.
outputs: Functions to load performance-optimized TF.js models

steps.description: Build the first solver, ensuring the canvas overlay and feedback rendering are performant on mobile.
outputs: A performant solver function for mobile

phases.title: Cinematic UI for Mobile
phases.description: Adapt the cinematic UI and effects for a mobile, touch-screen experience.

steps.description: Apply CSS effects to the video element, testing for performance on mobile.
Design the camera UI for a mobile viewport. Consider locking screen orientation to landscape for the camera view.
Ensure all camera controls (record button, camera switch) are large, accessible, and easy to use with a thumb.
